sections.content:
*I only wrote one recap for the first three weeks of the 2024 season. So, Weeks 1-3 on the website will look **very familiar**.*

You know, it's pretty nice when I go undefeated to start the season, just like I did last year when I went  **7-0** to start things.
_**Checks notes**_
Wait. I haven't won yet. That's good, right? I got you all right where I want you.
At least with my current record, you guys won't have to stage another coup against me anytime soon. ;)

As usual, I'll not be proofreading all of this. So, yeah, deal with the error of my ways. (Not sure that's how you use that idiom but I digress.)

sections.intro: After three weeks, how are things looking?
bullets: Even though the last place idiot (me) is at **0-3**, I'm still only **two** games behind first place. So, there's that, oddly enough. Haha.
My team is leading in  **last** in  **Points For** with  **347.44** and we're also leading in  **Points Against** with  **480.44**, hence the  **0-3** start. Thanks, CMAC.
Oh, and there's only  **one winless** **team**. Mine. Suck it.
sections.outro: Letâ€™s see how it plays out.

sections.intro: Here are some injuries paired with who had to endure those injuries on their team.
bullets: Cooper Kupp - Let The Force Be With Vu
Tua Tagovailoa - Hock Tua (Now a free agent)
Adam Thielen - A Hall Lotta Love (Now a free agent)
sections.outro:
The list goes on but those creamy hamstrings and ankles sure are hurting those fantasy teams these days. Tua getting hurt is very notable because without anyone to throw the ball to Hill (Hoc Tua taking him third overall), he'll likely not even finish a Top 10 WR. That's unfortunate considering Hock Tua was likely licking his lips for that Tua/Hill combo all season.

I imagine it was something like that on draft day. At least you're **2-1**, though.

pointsLeader.name: Rev. Dongo Pewee
pointsLeader.notes:
One way to get your first loss in a new league is by not having your key players really perform, like Tua (**0.0 on IR**) and Hill (**7.0**), while facing a guy that drops over  **200** on you in  Week  3. Welcome to I75 League, Hock Tua. Haha.

In fairness, even if Tua was still around, it's not likely anyone is going to topple  **209.12**.

dud.name: Two Words: Crap Team (You can say that again. Am I right?)
dud.notes: Heg got lucky this week because Nick was the dud.

matchups.team1: Let The Force Be With Vusdahjfdlsjakfdjskal;sdfj
matchups.breakdown:
Talk about a heartbreaking way to open the season. However, since then, Let The Force Be With Vu has won **two in a row** while averaging **146.87** in that timespan.

Meanwhile, A Hall Lotta Love has gone **1-1** since then while averaging more points with **148.73**.

Funny how that works, isn't it?
This one was a little surprising and not because I didn't think The Couple would do well...

sections.content:
So, we're here in e-mail form, yet again. I've added a few things to the website but nothing concrete, yet. I'm working on a few things. Also, I'm having trouble publishing new changes again (which has been a pain, for whatever reason). So, bear with me but the site is coming soon. I know, I know. You've all heard that before.
Also, I'm thinking of slightly switching the format of the recaps. Instead of me breaking down each game, I think I'll just break down one game a week that I find the most interesting, with a possible honorable mention. Thoughts?
I really enjoyed the video call with everyone on draft day. It was fun. And big thanks to Mikey for getting us the lake house. Hopefully next year, more of you can make it to draft in person.

I want to call out my matchup, simply because it might be a tight matchup (looks to be the closest one on the board, as of right meow) and it'd be nice to get my first win. Plus, I wanted to take Bijan in the draft but I thought the only logical thing to do was take CMAC. It's almost like having the #1  pick this year was a curse (unless, of course, CMAC comes roaring back by like,  Week  8). Had I been at #2, I would've taken Bijan.
Now, I have to face Bijan this  week  while CMAC is in Germany with some witch doctor (or whatever). I don't see me pulling this one out while Rachel has Bijan, Henry, Malik, and DK but we shall see. Maybe Hurts can bounce back against Tampa but maybe not.
I have to mention another rivalry between Two Words and Rev. This one will likely be a bit lopsided (even though Crap Team just broke 163) but here's to hoping the upset can be pulled off. Or, you know, maybe both teams will lose.
sections.imageAlt: Bromberg vs Not shaving my legs for this

sections.content:
**As always, good luck to you all, except for Smelly.**
(I hope you stub your toe.)
